A: 1. A person regarded as special for brave deeds is a (a) Governor (b) President (c) Hero
2. Which is a popular dance among the Tiv people (a) Ekombi (b) Swange (c) Bata
3. Okun are the ______________ speaking group in Kogi state (a) Yoruba (b) Hausa
4. The Mumuye are also known as (a) Fulani (b) Gengle
5. The Mumuye can be found in which state (a) Adamawa (b) Taraba (c) Bauchi
6. Which town has a major Okun population (a) Kaaba (b) Lagos
7. The traditional occupation of Fulani men is (a) Farming (b) Cattle rearing
8. Which is a cultural festival of the Ibibio (a) New yam (c) Ekpe
9. The language spoken by the Igala is (a) Efik (b) Igala (c) Hausa
10. The _____________ people can be found in towns like Oturkpo, Owukpa and Ogboju (a) Idoma (b) Igala (c) Fulani
11. The Kalabari's people's favourite food include ____________ and fisherman soup (a) Onunu (b) Isiewu (c) Afang
12. Who was the founder of Opobo kingdom (a) Ladi Kwali (b) King Jaja (c) Oba Ovonramwen
13. A female hero is called (a) Heroine (b) Herower
14. Who designed the Nigerian flag (b) Pa Michael Taiwo Akinkunmi
15. Jaja of Opobo was the leader of (c) Opobo kingdom
16. Nigeria has many heroes and heroines who have made Nigeria proud through their contributions (a) True (b) False
17. The early heros are dead while some of the modern heroes are still alive (a) True (b) False
18. Who died in 1891 (a) Pa Michael Taiwo Akinkunmi
B: 1. A person that is regarded as a special person by people because he has done something brave is known as _________ _________ _________ _________ _________
2. The traditional occupation of Fulani men is _________ _________ _________ _________ _________
4. The _____________ people can be found in towns like Oturkpo, Owukpa and Ogboju _________ _________ _________ _________ _________
7. Nigeria has many heroes and heroines who have made Nigeria proud through their _________ _________ _________ _________ _________
8. The early heros are _________ _________ _________ _________ _________ while some of the modern heroes are still alive
9. The Kalabari's people's favourite food include _________ _________ _________ _________ _________ and fisherman soup
C: 1. Discuss the significance of heroes and heroines in Nigerian history.
2. Explain the cultural importance of traditional dances in Nigerian societies.
3. Analyze the impact of cultural festivals on community cohesion in Nigeria.
